channel.title: BBC News - Europe

item.title: Europe floods: Merkel shocked by 'surreal' devastation
item.description: The chancellor vows to fast-track aid after visiting some of the worst-hit areas in western Germany.

item.title: Germany floods: Where are the worst-hit areas?
item.description: Maps, images and graphics showing the heavy rainfall and flooding that has caused widespread damage.

item.title: Cannes Film Festival: Titane wins top Palme d'Or prize
item.description: The outlandish Titane wins after jury president Spike Lee reveals the award in a ceremony slip-up.

item.title: 'Havana syndrome'-like mystery illness affects Vienna US diplomats
item.description: The Biden administration is investigating cases of "Havana syndrome" among US officials.

item.title: The migrants hunger-striking for legal status in Belgium
item.description: More than 400 go without food demanding a clear path to residency in Belgium.

item.title: Covid-19: Ireland's top medical officers targeted by abusive calls
item.description: GardaÃ­ are investigating reports of abusive calls to Ireland's chief medical officer and his deputy.

item.title: Climate change: Science failed to predict flood and heat intensity
item.description: Scientists want a super-computer powerful enough to accurately project the most damaging extremes.

item.title: Belgium takes back mothers and children from Syria jihadist camps
item.description: It is the biggest repatriation of suspected Islamic State members since its fall in 2019.

item.title: Biden and Merkel 'united against Russia aggression'
item.description: "Good friends can disagree," Mr Biden says of their dispute over a Russia-to-Germany pipeline.

item.title: Peter R de Vries: Dutch crime reporter dies after shooting
item.description: Relatives of journalist Peter R de Vries say he has died nine days after being shot in Amsterdam.

item.title: Climate change: 'No more excuses' at COP26 climate summit - poor nations
item.description: More than 100 developing countries set out key demands ahead of the climate summit in Glasgow.

item.title: Tour: Bahrain-Victorious team investigated
item.description: French prosecutors open a preliminary investigation into doping allegations against Bahrain-Victorious after their team hotel and bus was searched.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Partner vows to keep searching for missing hiker
item.description: The partner of missing hiker Esther Dingley explains why he won't give up searching for her.

item.title: Czech women seek compensation for coerced sterilisations
item.description: Thousands of women were sterilised without their consent in former Czechoslovakia in the 1970s and 1980s.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Formula 1 boss Ross Brawn says hydrogen could be future fuel
item.description: Hydrogen-powered cars could be the future of Formula 1 according to Ross Brawn, the F1 managing director for motorsports.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Don't sell your technology too early'
item.description: The CEO of an eco-friendly textiles firm advises holding out for the biggest customer you can find

item.title: Clean-up operations in flood-hit western Europe
item.description: Record rainfall in western Europe has caused rivers to burst their banks, leaving dozens dead.

item.title: Germany floods: 'My city looks like a battlefield'
item.description: Witnesses voice their grief and horror at the deadly floods in western Germany.

item.title: Severe flooding in western Europe
item.description: Tomasz Schafernaker has the latest update on the deadly flooding in Germany and Belgium after days of heavy rain.

item.title: Europe floods: Neighbourhoods clear up after record rainfall
item.description: BBC Netherlands correspondent Anna Holligan is in Valkenburg, where some residents have been forced to leave their homes.

item.title: In pictures: Floods kill dozens
item.description: Record rainfall caused rivers to burst their banks, leaving at least 122 dead in Germany and Belgium.

item.title: Europe floods: Residents return home to see damage inflicted
item.description: Resident in Kleivelderweg, deep inside the Dutch disaster zone, find homes and businesses destroyed.

item.title: Drone footage shows flood damage in Germany and Belgium
item.description: At least 120 people have died and hundreds more are unaccounted for in western Europe.

item.title: Germany floods: Helicopter rescues residents from rooftops
item.description: Dozens of people have died and many more are missing after severe floods in Germany.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The gymnasts 'building bridges between cultures'
item.description: The town of Murayama in northern Japan is preparing to welcome a team of Bulgarian Olympians.

item.title: Angela Merkel and four US presidents
item.description: The German chancellor, who first took office in the Bush era, makes a farewell visit to Washington DC.
